_sText:
Tactical Situation:

 Suspects have robbed a bank in North Hollywood. They wounded several civilians, detonated an explosive and are preparing an escape from the bank. SWAT has arrived now and will try to neutralize the suspects.

Terrorists:

 Make your way to the white truck at the end of the road ("A" on your radar), 3 blocks far away. If you reach the escape point all CTs will be eliminated and you win. Or simply eliminate all CTs. -16 Spawnpoints in the bank.

Counter-Terrorists:

 You must prevent the Ts from fleeing to the white truck ("A" on the radar). If ANY suspect can reach this escape point all CTs will get killed and the terrorists win. Neutralize them all. -16 spawnpoints in total at 2 APCs Note: I made an ESCAPE map, so the bomb is not important!!! After all i should even mention that this map is an attempt to recreate the tactical situation of the so called "North Hollywood Shootout". Watch a movie about the "North Hollywood Shootout" An extraction from wikipedia.org: "The North Hollywood shootout was an armed confrontation between two heavily-armed and armored bank robbers (Larry Eugene Phillips, Jr. and Emil Dechebal Matasareanu) and patrol and SWAT officers of the Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) on February 28, 1997, at a Bank of America teller-office. The shootout resulted in the wounding of fourteen people (twelve police officers and two civilians) and the deaths of both bank robbers. Although only the suspects were killed, the sheer number of injuries made this one of the bloodiest single cases of violent crime in the 1990s, and one of the most significant single bank robberies of the 20th century." Final Notes: Of course this is not 1:1 but some key locations may look a lot like on the publicly available TV reports, documents etc. while other elements are completely fictional but tactically interesting... So mainly this map focusses on playability issues. All in all i find it a easy to learn and challenging map. Hope you enjoy it too! the map was made by me, foxconn SO report bugs, errors, feedback to jpdelacruz@web.de
